instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115b  fire wire  frie : /
threads.message: I got this one whit  u9410 fried I take out  and than I feel the   U3890 was warm I changed same I found R3880 open I changed warm U3890 gone I fire up  but after time the U4100 star warm up I try to figure out from where but no luck   any help is  welcome : )

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115b  fire wire  frie : /
threads.message: Is this board working besides these issues?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115b  fire wire  frie : /
threads.message: yes it does, i found the u1800 and u3600 go warm too

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115b  fire wire  frie : /
threads.message: Why bother with this when it is working? Leave U9410 off and just live with the fact that the lightning port will never work again.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115b  fire wire  frie : /
threads.message: I install one different u9410 i don t find any short,  i can take it out again.   but  still have my u1800 and u3600 warm up i just found my infra temp reader i will post the temp after one min. tomorrow morning  thank for reply bro

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115b  fire wire  frie : /
threads.message: It is normal for U1800 and 3600 to heat up
